intro: Arctotis aspera var. scabra, commonly known as the rough arctotis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and vibrant, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance. The species is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
